headline: Sen. Mark Kelly bill would suspend federal gas tax to ease costs
author: Cami Parrish
sentences:
“This bill will lower gas prices by suspending the federal gas tax through the end of the year to help Arizona families struggling with high costs for everything from gas to groceries.”
The federal gas tax, established in 1932, has been primarily used to fund the Highway Trust Fund, which is meant to finance public mass transit projects.

“Arizonans are paying some of the highest prices for gas we have seen in years and it’s putting a strain on families who need to fill up the tank to get to work and school,“ Kelly, whose Senate seat is on the ballot this year, said in a written statement.

If the legislation passes, a provision of the proposed law would require that the Department of Treasury move general funds into the Highway Trust Fund in order to ensure that the trust is still capable of funding mass transit projects.
According to AAA’s gas price data, the average price of gas in the United States on Wednesday was $3.469 a gallon, compared with $2.469 a gallon, the national average on Feb. 9, 2021.
According to the Urban Institute and Brookings Institution’s Tax Policy Center, about 84% of annual revenue that is put toward the Highway Trust Fund is collected through fuel taxes.
Inflation rates have risen up to 40-year highs, putting pressure on U.S. lawmakers in an election year to make it a priority to lower everyday costs for everyday people.
Sen. Mark Kelly and Sen. Maggie Hassan are teaming up on legislation that would suspend the federal gas tax until 2023 in an attempt to lower gas prices.
The legislation also would require that the secretary of the Treasury monitor oil and gas companies to ensure that the customers do see lowered prices.
Kelly, D-Ariz., and Hassan, D-N.H., have introduced legislation that would lower the total price of gas by just under 20 cents per gallon.
The statewide average in Arizona on Wednesday was $3.656 a gallon, which is roughly 5.4% higher than the national average.
The federal gas tax is 18.4 cents per gallon for standard gasoline and 24.4 cents per gallon for diesel fuel.
With implementation of the Gas Prices Relief Act, the federal tax would be suspended until Jan. 1, 2023.
The same data shows that Arizona is among the states with the highest average gas prices in the country.
The other 16% is collected through taxes on heavy trucks, heavy truck tires, and taxes on tractors.
